post.description: Updates the authenticated user's first and last name
Changes the user's password using a reset token

get.description: Returns a list of all events

post.description: Creates a new event. Only master users can create events

get.description: Returns a list of all events created by a user
get.summary: Get events created by a user

get.description: Returns a list of all public events (where IsPublic=true)
Returns an event's details by its slug

delete.description: Deletes an existing event using its slug. Only master users can delete events

patch.description: Updates an existing event using its slug. Only master users can update events

get.description: The end point returns a list of all accesses for a specified user from a specified event
get.summary: Retrieves a list of accesses for a user from an event

get.description: Returns all activities for the specified event
get.summary: Get all activities for an event

post.description: Creates a new activity for the specified event
post.summary: Create a new activity for an event

delete.description: Deletes an existing activity from the specified event

patch.description: Updates an existing activity for the specified event

post.description: Marks a user as having attended an activity (admin only)

get.description: The end point returns a list of all attendants for a specified activity
get.summary: Retrieves a list of attendants for an activity

get.description: The end point returns a list of all registrations of a specified activity (all admins)
get.summary: Retrieves a list of registrations of an activity

post.description: Registers the authenticated user to an activity within an event they are already registered for
Registers the authenticated user to a standalone activity without requiring event registration
Removes a user's attendance record for an activity (master admin only)
Unregisters the authenticated user from an activity within an event
Unregisters the authenticated user from a standalone activity

Demotes a user from their admin role in an event. The following rules apply:
- Only super users, event creators and master admins can demote others
- Super users and event creators can demote any admin (master or normal)
- Master admins can only demote normal admins
- Users cannot demote themselves
- Super users and event creators cannot be demoted
- Super users and event creators cannot be promoted
- Target must be an admin of the event
- Targets can be demoted if they unregister from the event
Creates a new product for the specified event
post.summary: Create a product for an event

delete.description: Deletes an existing product from the specified event

patch.description: Updates an existing product for the specified event

get.description: Returns a list of all products for the specified event
get.summary: Get all products from an event

post.description:
Promotes a user to organizer role in an event. The following rules apply:
- Only master users and master admins can promote others
- Master users can promote normal users to admin or admins to master admin
- Master admins can only promote normal users to admin
- Users must be registered to the event to be promoted
- Users cannot promote themselves
- Master users cannot be promoted
Processes a purchase of products for the authenticated user
Registers the authenticated user to an event by its slug
Unregisters the authenticated user from an event by its slug

get.description: The end point returns a list of all activities for a specified user from a specified event
get.summary: Retrieves a list of activities for a user from an event

post.description:
Logging successfully creates a refresh token in the database so the user can
invalidate specific session from any other session\n
Returns both an Access Token of 5 minutes duration and a Refresh Token of 2 days duration
Invalidates the refresh token used in the request in the database, effectively logging out the user from the current session

get.description: Returns all refresh tokens associated with the user's account

post.description:
Register a new user in the system, generates a verification code that is stored
in the database for 24 hours and sent in a verification email to the user
post.summary: Register new user and send a verification email

post.description:
Invalidates a specific refresh token for the authenticated user
Can't be passed the same refresh token the user is using to access the route
Switches a user's event creator status (enables/disables ability to create events). Only available to super users.

get.description: The end point returns a list of all accesses for a specified user
get.summary: Retrieves a list of accesses for a user

get.description: The end point returns a list of all activities for a specified user
get.summary: Retrieves a list of activities for a user

get.description: Returns a list of all events for the authenticated user
Returns a list of all products for the authenticated user
Returns a list of all products for the authenticated user
Returns a list of all purchases for the authenticated user
Returns a list of all tokens for the authenticated user

post.description: Create an event creator
Validates the verification token sent to user's email and marks the account as verified
Validates both access token and refresh token signatures

valid.description: Valid is true if Time is not NULL

is_event.description: True if target is an event, false if activity

description.example: Workshop introdutrio sobre a linguagem Go

event_id.description: Event relationship - nullable for standalone activities

has_fee.description: If an event ticket or standalone ticket is required

has_unlimited_capacity.description: Changed from int to boolean flags for capacity management

is_blocked.description: Whether the activity is blocked from interactions

max_capacity.description: Max capacity when HasUnlimitedCapacity is false

needs_token.description: If a token is required for this activity

attended_at.description: Time of attendance, null if not attended yet

is_standalone_registration.description: Is this from an event or standalone

user_id.description: Optional, used for admin actions on other users

description.example: Workshop introdutrio sobre a linguagem Go
Workshop introdutrio sobre a linguagem Go

is_blocked.description: Whether the event is blocked from interactions

max_tokens_per_user.description: Maximum number of tokens a user can have for this event

access_targets.description: Relationships - combined into single table with type flag

event_id.description: event the product is associated with

is_activity_token.description: Can be used as tokens for fee-based activities

is_blocked.description: Whether the product is blocked from purchases

is_event_access.description: Product type flags - a product can be multiple types

is_hidden.description: Whether the product is hidden from search/listings

is_ticket_type.description: Is a ticket type (user can only have one)

product_id.description: Original product that created this token

user_product_id.description: Which user product this token belongs to
